title: Befriending Enemies: Within and Without
description: The worst enemy we face can be within.  Empowering this enemy restricts our capacities to serve and to love.  Likewise, our 'other' enemies interfere with our journey of becoming truly human.  The process of befriending enemies is impossible, tough, and potent, but contains the power/living water, to transform our journeys as true followers of Jesus.
speaker: smosteller

subSessions.title: Q&A
subSessions.description: Following her talk, there will be a Q&A session around what it means to love our enemies.
subSessions.speaker: smosteller

title: Love Your Enemies
description: This round of breakout sessions will be focused on what it means to love some of the hardest people in our cities.

subSessions.title: Understanding Current Dynamics in the World of Islam
subSessions.description: Current world events require deeper understanding of the world of Islam where religion, politics and economy are very much intertwined. A deeper understanding of Islamic religious beliefs will help us navigate the current complexities of  political and social upheavals. Issues like human rights and freedom will be explored from religious and historical perspectives.
subSessions.speaker: wwahba

title: Our Tears are All the Same Colour
description: It will examine Jesus command to love our enemies, pray for those who persecute us and to love our neighbour as ourselves. It will look at samples from scripture of radical hospitality as well as experiences at Matthew House (refugee ministry) Toronto and challenge people to overcome their fears and reach out and love the outsiders and strangers on our doorstep.
speaker: awoolger

title: Lunch
subtitle: with Roundtable Discussion
description: As we share in lunch, professors from Tyndale Seminary will be hosting a roundtable discussion about the Christian response to Syrian Refugee Crisis.

title: WikiGod Podcast Interview
description: Mark Groleau from the [WikiGod](http://www.wikigodpod.com/) podcast will be conducting a group interview with Tyndale Professors [Terry LeBlanc](#!) and [David Kupp](#!) about the role of contemporary Christianity in reshaping the culture of Toronto.
speaker: mgroleau

title: Love Your Neighbours
description: This round of breakout sessions is going to be focused on practical ways we can show love in our contexts.

subSessions.title: Radical Hospitality: Welcoming the Stranger
subSessions.description: What are the theological stakes involved in welcoming the stranger? This workshop explores several dimensions of hospitality, drawing on insights from the bible, theology, philosophy, and lived experience.
subSessions.speaker: jmckinney

title: After Party
description: Following the colloquium, we will be hosting an afterparty at [Puck and Wings](https://www.google.ca/maps/place/Puck+'N+Wings/@43.7809934,-79.4231927,14.86z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x882b2d0e0b45536b:0x234894619597ccfd), only a 12 minute drive from Tyndale. The afterparty is not associated with Tyndale Seminary.
